result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl A. Hawks Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any taverns/bars.
The defendant must take all medications and only take in the manner prescribed.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Carl A. Hawks in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State - has resolution. Scholke reads agreement - Count 1 would be DRI, defendant would plead NC to count 2, NC plea to count 3 - and count 4 would be amended to 946.49(1)(a), misd. bail jumping. Joint recommendation of 2 years of probation, 120 days FC jail (count 2 only), court costs on all counts, AODA, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into bars/tavers, full time employment, 200 hours of community service, take all medication as prescribed. Court DRI count 1 and amends count 4 to misd. BJ, reads new penalties. Defendant pleads NC to all counts. Court goes over PLQ with defendant and finds the defendant is freely, voluntairly and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights. Court finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. State makes final statement, has complied with victim notification and no statements submitted, and asks court to adopt joint recommendation. Scholke make statement, asks for time to report-2 weeks, no jail credit and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Hawks makes statement, remorseful. Court adopts joint recommendation and proceeds to sentencing: Count 2:  With hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years: with conditions of 120 days FC jail-huber allowed, court costs on all counts, AODA and follow through, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into bars/tavers, full time employment, 200 hours of community service, take all medication as prescribed. Must report to jail on 12-31-15 at 4:00 PM. Counts 3 & 4: With hold sentence and place onprobation for 2 years, same conditons, no additional jail or community service. DNA sample and appeal rights given.

Defendant Carl A. Hawks in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:26 PM. Schoelke - not resolved - understands the ramifications of rejecting the offer. State puts offer on record, plead to counts #2, #3 and #4, 120 days on each count #2 and #3 - conseuctive to each other, place on probation on count #4. Hawks understands. Court continues bond, set for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carl A. Hawks in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:42 PM. Scholke has been provided with discovery but no offer has been made and asks for adjournment.  Court questions state as to where offer may be. Court adjourns to allow time for state to make offer. Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Carl A. Hawks in court with attorney Michael Scholke.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:19 PM. Scholke has complaint, waives reading of it, will be waiving PH as well and files waiver of PH form. Hawks agrees. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial, will proceed to ARGN as long as Information will mirror complaint. State agrees. Scholke will proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court continues bond, accepts plea, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Carl A. Hawks in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:32 AM. Defendant has supplied the Court with the completed court appointed attorney paperwork. Court reviews it, will appoint an attorney, reimburse at the rate of $200.00/month commencing 8/1/15, continues bond, sets for AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Carl A. Hawks Jr.
Current: 609 South Grandview, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 07-08-2015)
Prior: 606 South Grandview, Crandon, WI 54520
No contact with the victim (S.D.) and no contact or affiliation with Greg Bradley.

Defendant Carl A. Hawks in court.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:12 PM. Court asks defendant why he was not in court on 6/24/15. Defendant explains, was subpoenaed for today. State -that was on a co-defendant case. Hawks has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Hawks understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney. Court will quash the warrant, gives ramifications of appearing without an attorney at the next hearing. Court supplies defendant with court appointed attorney form and attorney list. State - bond - $3000 signature bond, no contact with the victim (S.D.) and no contact or affiliation with Greg Bradley.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Carl A. Hawks not in court, nor any attorney on his behalf. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:23 pm. Summons & complaint mailed and not returned. State asks for warrant. Court issues warrant, body or $1000.
